briefdescription.para: Current bounding rectangle of shape.
Max symbol bleed.
Shape's nodes.
This tag is used to indicate if we have to draw nodes or not during the painting.
The index of the node currently selected.
Add a node in current shape.

parameterdescription.para: is the location of the new node (in scene coordinates)
is a flag to indicate if there's a space constraint.
is the space contraint and is used only if checkArea is true. Typically, if this flag is true, the new node has to be nearer than radius to the shape to be added.

briefdescription.para: Deselects any selected nodes.
Returns the estimated amount the item's frame bleeds outside the item's actual rectangle.

detaileddescription.para: For instance, if the item has a 2mm frame stroke, then 1mm of this frame is drawn outside the item's rect. In this case the return value will be 1.0.
Returned values are in layout units.

briefdescription.para: Moves a node to a new position.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the node to move
is the new position in scene coordinate

memberdef.argsstring: (QPointF point, bool searchInRadius=true, double radius=10) const
memberdef.name: nodeAtPosition

briefdescription.para: Search for the nearest node in the shape within a maximal area.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the index of the nearest node or -1 if no node was found.
point
is the location to search for nodes from (in scene coordinates)
searchInRadius
is a flag to indicate if the area of research is limited in space.
radius
is only used if searchInRadius is true

briefdescription.para: Gets the position of a node in scene coordinates.

simplesect.para: true if the index is valid and the position is set, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns the nodes the shape consists of.
Returns the number of nodes in the shape.
Remove a node with specified index from the shape.
Returns the currently selected node, or -1 if no node is selected.
Set whether the item's nodes should be displayed.
Sets the nodes the shape consists of.
Selects a node by index.
Constructor for QgsLayoutNodesItem, attached to the specified layout.
Constructor for a QgsLayoutNodesItem with the given polygon nodes, attached to the specified layout.
Method called in addNode.
Method called in paint.
Method called in readXml.
Method called in removeNode.
Method called in writeXml.
Compute an euclidian distance between 2 nodes.
Draws the item's contents using the specified item render context.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the context's painter has been scaled so that painter units are pixels. Use the QgsRenderContext methods to convert from millimeters or other units to the painter's units.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomElement &element, const QDomDocument &document, const QgsReadWriteContext &context) override
memberdef.name: readPropertiesFromElement

briefdescription.para: Sets item state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
element
is the DOM element for the item
document
DOM document
context
read write context
Note that item subclasses should not rely on all other items being present in the layout at the time this method is called. Instead, any connections and links to other items must be made in the finalizeRestoreFromXml() method. E.g. when restoring a scalebar, the connection to the linked map's signals should be implemented in finalizeRestoreFromXml(), not readPropertiesFromElement().

briefdescription.para: Rescale the current shape according to the item's bounding box.

detaileddescription.para: Useful when the shape is resized thanks to the rubber band.

briefdescription.para: Update the current scene rectangle for this item.
Stores item state within an XML DOM element.

parameterdescription.para: is the DOM element to store the item's properties in

briefdescription.para: Called when the bounding rect of the item should recalculated.

detaileddescription.para: Subclasses should update currentRectangle in their implementations.

briefdescription.para: Draw nodes.
An abstract layout item that provides generic methods for node based shapes such as polygon or polylines.
